item.title: Making Git Pushes Less Annoying
item.description: For a long time now I’ve been quite annoyed by how much of a pain it can be to do simple things with git. Even changes to your own repositories can take a while with all of the adding and committing and then typing in your credentials. Thankfully though, I have found ways to make git almost trivial to use, now I barely have to enter more than one command for most tasks, here is how I did it:

item.title: Why I Stopped Using Windows
item.description: Before we begin, a confession, I used to really like Windows, I admit that it was an “ignorant bliss” kind of thing, but back then I didn’t really know much better. I used it often and started liking it even more when I began using some of it’s more hidden, “power user oriented” features, such as the built in window management and multitasking capabilities. And while I did have quite a good time in my years using Windows, reality dawned on me in early 2020.

item.title: Books I've Been Reading
item.description: Series Author Series Download (book 1) Brandon Sanderson The Stormlight Archive The Way of Kings Patrick Rothfuss The Kingkiller Chronicle The Name of The Wind Robert Jordan The Wheel of Time The Eye of The World Christopher Ruocchio Sun Eater Empire of Silence Singles (fiction) Author Book Download Brandon Sanderson Elantris EPUB Stephen King Doctor Sleep PDF John Steinbeck The Grapes of Wrath PDF Brandon Sanderson Warbreaker EPUB Singles (non-fiction) Author Book Download Saif’ ur-Rahman Mubarakpuri The Sealed Nectar EPUB Jake Knapp and John Zeratsky Make Time PDF Graham Alcott How to be a Productivity Ninja EPUB Michael Bazzel Open Source Intelligence PDF Tim Ferriss Tribe of Mentors TOR

item.title: Some of My Favorite Software
item.description: Just a list of some software I find nice to use, most are pretty minimal as well: cfm Simple and fast terminal file manager maim Extremely powerful CLI screenshot tool SXIV “Simple X Image Viewer” giph Customizable and easy to use GIF recorder birch Freenode IRC client written in bash farge Finally a lightweight CLI colorpicker ungoogled-chromium Browse safely and privately, no compromises ST Simple Terminal shfm Terminal file browser written in bash epy Terminal based Ebook reader wpm Command line typing test cchat-gtk GTK+ frontend for cchat’s

item.title: Linux and CLI, a 101
item.description: When I first started with Linux, and especially the command line, It was difficult to find a truly optimal and comprehensive guide to these things. While most tutorials were nice and gave me a good starting point, they usually provided inefficient information or didn’t showcase the most optimal commands/strategies. I am making this list as more of a dump for all of the things that I have learned about bash so far, which isn’t too much compared to some but I like to think that I know something.

item.title: My Top 10 Best Looking Cars
item.description: Mercedes AMG GT-R One of the only cars in recent times to really pose a threat to the sales of the 911, the GT does a good job of representing a similar muscular and round look while also adhering to the aesthetic of it’s predecessor, the SLS AMG. Datsun 240z Fairlady One of the most well-known sports cars of it’s time and now a JDM legend, the amount of things that have been done to the Datsun are insane, here is NightRide’s iteration of the vehicle, one of the best looking ones I’ve found:
